metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: Bash cd - Change Directory
Using the cd Command
The cd command is used to change the current working directory in the terminal.
content.html: The cd command is used to change the current working directory in the terminal.

content.text: Basic Usage
To change to a specific directory, use cd directory_name :
content.html: To change to a specific directory, use cd directory_name:

content.code_html: cd my_directory

content.text: Options Overview
The cd command supports several useful options for navigating directories:
content.html: The cd command supports several useful options for navigating directories:

content.text: cd .. Option: Move Up One Directory Level
The cd .. command lets you go to the folder above your current one.
content.html: The cd .. command lets you go to the folder above your current one.

content.text: It's useful when you need to go to the parent folder.
content.html: It's useful when you need to go to the parent folder.

content.code_html: cd ..

content.text: cd ~ Option: Change to Home Directory
The cd ~ command takes you to your home directory, which is the default directory for your user account.
content.html: The cd ~ command takes you to your home directory, which is the default directory for your user account.

content.text: This option is useful when you need to return to your starting point after navigating through various directories.
content.html: This option is useful when you need to return to your starting point after navigating through various directories.

content.code_html: cd ~

content.text: cd - Option: Switch to Previous Directory
The cd - command switches your working directory to the previous one you were in.
content.html: The cd - command switches your working directory to the previous one you were in.

content.text: This option is useful for toggling between two directories without needing to type their full paths repeatedly.
content.html: This option is useful for toggling between two directories without needing to type their full paths repeatedly.

content.code_html: cd -

content.text: cd / Option: Change to Root Directory
The cd / command takes you to the root directory of the file system.
content.html: The cd / command takes you to the root directory of the file system.

content.text: This option is useful when you need to access system-wide files or directories.
content.html: This option is useful when you need to access system-wide files or directories.

content.code_html: cd /

content.text: Combining Options
The cd command itself does not support combining options, but you can use it in conjunction with other commands to enhance navigation efficiency.
content.html: The cd command itself does not support combining options, but you can use it in conjunction with other commands to enhance navigation efficiency.

content.text: For example, using cd with ls can quickly show you the contents of a directory you navigate to:
content.html: For example, using cd with ls can quickly show you the contents of a directory you navigate to:

content.code:
cd
my_directory
&&

ls

copy_of_my_file.txt  Cosmere_RPG_Beta_Rules_Preview.pdf
images/  my_file.txt  myfolder/  report.csv  voiceover.wav
content.code_html:
cd my_directory && ls
copy_of_my_file.txt  Cosmere_RPG_Beta_Rules_Preview.pdf
images/  my_file.txt  myfolder/  report.csv  voiceover.wav

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
What is the correct command to switch to your home directory.
content.html: What is the correct command to switch to your home directory.
